intro: Moehringia tejedensis var. rifana, commonly known as the Rif Moehringia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of North Africa. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It has narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence, aiding in water retention. The flowers are usually pale blue or white, contributing to its ecological role in pollination and seed dispersal.
